has_sum_linear_isometry_equiv_symm:
/-- In the canonical isometric isomorphism between a Hilbert sum `E` of `G` and `lp G 2`,
a vector `w : lp G 2` is the image of the infinite sum of the associated elements in `E`, and this
sum indeed converges. -/
protected theorem is_hilbert_sum.has_sum_linear_isometry_equiv_symm (hV : is_hilbert_sum ğ•œ E V) (w : lp G 2) :
    has_sum (fun i => V i (w i)) (hV.linear_isometry_equiv.symm w) := by
  simp [is_hilbert_sum.linear_isometry_equiv, orthogonal_family.has_sum_linear_isometry]
#align is_hilbert_sum.has_sum_linear_isometry_equiv_symm is_hilbert_sum.has_sum_linear_isometry_equiv_symm
has_sum_linear_isometry:
protected theorem has_sum_linear_isometry (f : lp G 2) : has_sum (fun i => V i (f i)) (hV.linear_isometry f) :=
  (hV.summable_of_lp f).has_sum
#align has_sum_linear_isometry has_sum_linear_isometry

has_sum_inner:

dense_span:

@[simp]
protected theorem dense_span (b : hilbert_basis Î¹ ğ•œ E) : (span ğ•œ (Set.range b)).topological_closure = Â«exprâŠ¤Â» := by
  classical

    rintro i -
    refine' smul_mem _ _ _
    exact subset_span âŸ¨i, rflâŸ©
#align dense_span dense_span
